metadata.name: All Japanese Words
metadata.description: First-generation Japanese words from various sources including dictionaries and language databases.
metadata.source: Various Japanese language resources and databases

schema.label: Kanji
schema.description: Canonical dictionary/headword kanji form if one exists, EVEN IF it is rare or not commonly used in daily writing. This field represents the linguistically recognized kanji spelling, not the most common display form. If no established kanji exists, use the standard kana/katakana headword instead. Use `orthography` to indicate what people typically write in real-world usage. Examples: 林檎 (usually written りんご), 今日, 勉強, ありがとう (no standard kanji), ドキドキ (no kanji).

schema.label: Reading
schema.description: The pronunciation, written in kana (usually hiragana; katakana ok for katakana words). Examples: あくま, ありがとう, どきどき / ドキドキ.

schema.label: Meaning
schema.description: English gloss/translation. Keep it short; add nuance in example notes when needed.

schema.label: Type
schema.description: Grammatical classification: how it behaves in sentences. Use `lexicalClass` to capture families like onomatopoeia or greetings that can cross POS. Rules of thumb: if it is one lexical word, pick noun/verb/adj/adverb/etc. If it is multi-word or a fixed chunk, pick expression/phrase/sentence types.

values.noun: Standalone noun (名詞). Can take particles like が/を/に. Example: 本, 勉強.
values.proper-noun: Proper noun (固有名詞): specific names of people/places/organizations (e.g., 太郎, 東京, 日本, アメリカ, ユニクロ). Use for names you generally don’t want treated as normal vocab.
values.standalone-noun: A single kanji that can stand alone as a noun WITHOUT okurigana (rare; only when truly used alone).
values.compound-morpheme: Bound morpheme used mainly inside compounds; not typically a standalone word (e.g., 〜学, 〜性).
values.verb-stem: Kanji/root that appears as part of a verb requiring okurigana; not a full dictionary-form verb by itself (e.g., 受け in 受ける).
values.numeral: Number words / numeric forms (一, 二, ３, etc.). Use `counter` for counter words like 〜枚, 〜人.
values.ichidan-verb: 一段動詞 dictionary form (e.g., 食べる, 見る).
values.godan-verb: 五段動詞 dictionary form (e.g., 書く, 泳ぐ).
values.irregular-verb: Irregular verbs (する, 来る) and irregular verb entries.
values.i-adjective: い-adjective (い形容詞) (e.g., 高い, 忙しい).
values.na-adjective: な-adjective (な形容詞) (e.g., 便利, きれい).
values.particle: Particle / function word (e.g., は, が, を, に, で, から, まで).
values.adverb: Adverb (副詞) or adverb-like word used to modify verbs/clauses (e.g., すぐ, ゆっくり). Many mimetics belong here (ドキドキ(と)する, キラキラ(と)光る) — mark those with lexicalClass='onomatopoeia'.
values.conjunction: Connective/conjunction (接続詞) linking clauses/sentences (e.g., でも, そして).
values.counter: Counter word used with numerals (e.g., 〜人, 〜枚, 〜つ).
values.expression: Fixed conventional phrase (often multi-word) that is used as a unit (e.g., おつかれさま, しょうがない). Not a full sentence unless it clearly contains its own predicate.
values.descriptive-phrase: Descriptive multi-word phrase used as a modifier or chunk (often not fully idiomatic).
values.sentence: Full sentence with its own predicate (usually ends with a verb/です/ます etc.).
values.phrase-sentence: Clause-like chunk that forms a complete predicate unit (shorter than a full sentence record, but still predicate-bearing).

schema.label: Lexical Class
schema.description: Lexical family / usage domain (word 'kind'), independent of grammar `type`. Use this to capture important categories that cross parts of speech: onomatopoeia/mimetics, manga SFX, greetings, interjections, and set phrases. Defaults to 'regular' when none apply.

values.regular: Normal lexical item with no special family tag.
values.onomatopoeia: Sound-symbolic mimetic (擬音語・擬態語): often repeated patterns and used with と or する (e.g., ドキドキ, キラキラ, ワクワク, ベタベタ). Usually type='adverb' (or sometimes noun/na-adjective in specific uses).
values.sfx: Sound-effect token (especially manga/quotes): often standalone with ！/… and not a normal dictionary word (e.g., ドン！, ゴー！, ピッ).
values.set-phrase: Fixed conventional chunk (定型表現) learned as a unit; may not map cleanly to a single POS (e.g., しょうがない).
values.greeting: Greeting/aisatsu (挨拶): used in social exchange (e.g., こんにちは, おつかれさま).
values.interjection: Spontaneous utterance (感動詞): あっ, えっ, へえ, ええと.

schema.label: Orthography
schema.description: Indicates the script usually used to write the word. Helpful for words like 'いちご' (usually kana) or loanwords that are katakana-only.

values.kanji: Primarily written in kanji (漢字), okurigana as needed.
values.hiragana: Primarily written in kana (平仮名 or 片仮名), rarely uses its possible kanji form
values.both: Both kanji and kana are commonly used (context-dependent).
values.katakana: Primarily written in katakana (片仮名), often loanwords or mimetics.

schema.label: Tags
schema.description: Optional machine-friendly tags for filtering/grouping. Use short snake_case strings. Examples: fractional_numeral, jlpt_n3, grammar_marker, formal, casual, written, spoken, counter_related.

entries.meaning: on earth; in the world (used in questions for emphasis)
for a long time; all the time; (much) more
both; two (bound form used as a prefix in compounds)
spirit; mind; energy; mood; air; feeling
standalone kanji; a kanji used alone, not in a compound or with okurigana
three days; the third day of the month
two (long cylindrical things; e.g., bottles, pencils)
first; number one (ordinal form using 第)
to fall; to go down; to step back
to give one's name; to introduce oneself
to remove; to unfasten; to be away
to ask again; to check by asking
to add writing; to add a note
to jump out; to rush out
to cut off; to cut away
to tell each other; to argue/exchange words
to compromise; to come to terms
to call to one another; to call each other
to come into contact; to interact
to compete for; to take in turns; to deal with
to miss hearing; to fail to catch (audio)
to give up on; to judge/decide (from context)
to drop by; to stop by
to be raised; to come up (issue/event)
to drink and go around (bar hopping)
to search around; to look all over
to probe around; to look/search stealthily
to hear reports; to reach one's ears
to ask someone to repeat; to ask back
to lose sight of; to miss
to cry out; to scream while crying
to play; to hang out; to have fun
to fly; to jump; to go fast (e.g., time passes quickly)
to call; to invite; to name
to carry; to transport; to move (something)
to be happy; to喜ぶ; to be delighted
to make noise; to make a fuss
to spin (thread); to weave; to build (a story)
to shave off; to pare down
to hear; to listen; to ask
to become empty; to be vacant
to bake; to grill; to burn
to assemble; to pair; to cross arms
to hope; to desire; to look out over; to face
to be rich in; to abound in
to blur; to smudge; to ooze
to be dejected; to lose heart
to resent; to hold a grudge
to enter; to go in; to come in
to see; to watch; to look
to wake up; to get up
to sleep; to go to bed
to wear (on the upper body); to put on
to go out; to leave; to come out; to appear
to make empty; to vacate; to clear (space/time)
to go out (a light/fire); to disappear
to remember; to memorize; to learn
to bathe in; to take (a shower); to receive (criticism, etc.)
to pick up; to welcome; to迎える
to convey; to tell; to pass on (a message)
to check; to investigate; to look up
to decide; to choose; to set
to finish; to end; to complete
to recognize; to admit; to approve
to raise; to grow; to bring up (a child)
to receive; to take (a test); to accept
to get off (a train/bus); to go down; to descend
to fall; to drop; to go down (price); to fail (an exam)
to be enough; to be sufficient
to pass; to exceed; to be too much
to grow; to stretch; to improve
to make a mistake; to get wrong
to wake up; to come to senses; (heat) to cool down
to advance; to proceed; to move forward; to promote
to be late; to fall behind
to get dirty; to be stained
to touch; to come into contact; to mention briefly
to be audible; to be heard
to name; to give a name
to exist (animate); to be (someone is here)
to be able to; can do; to be made; to be completed
to tidy up; to put in order; to clean up
to attach; to add; to turn on (a light); to set (a rule/condition)
to stop (something); to turn off; to park (a car)
to come off; to be removed; to be obtained/caught
to hang (something); to put on; to apply; to make a call
to go out; to leave (home) for a while
to replace by buying a new one
to see something through; to witness to completion
to address; to speak to someone
to postpone; to refrain after consideration
to pull up; to raise; to withdraw
tough; hard; serious; very (adverbial use also common)
New Year's Eve; passing the year
polite verb form ending in ～ます
negative verb form ending in ～ない
te-form; connective verb form used for sequences, requests, and aspect
past tense verb form ending in ～た
ra-dropping speech; colloquial omission of ら in potential forms (e.g., 食べれる)
terms of service; terms of use
mobile phone (short for 携帯電話)
contracted sound (e.g., きょ / しゃ)
voiced consonants (が, ぎ, ぐ... with ゛)
semi-voiced (ぱ, ぴ, ぷ... with ゜)
standalone; independent (used to describe a kanji appearing alone, not in a compound)
inflection; conjugation of a word to express grammatical meaning
conjugated form; an inflected verb or adjective form
word stem; the core part of a word before inflection
word ending; inflectional ending of a verb or adjective
dictionary form; plain non-past form of a verb
potential form; expresses ability or possibility
volitional form; expresses intention or suggestion (～よう)
imperative form; used to give commands
godan verb; verb that conjugates across five vowel rows
ichidan verb; verb with a single stem used for conjugation
transitive verb; verb that takes a direct object
intransitive verb; verb that does not take a direct object
one side; one of a pair
log in; sign in (noun/verb in Japanese UI)
one thousand (formal/old variant used in documents)

to stretch completely; to reach full extension
full of; covered with (usually negative nuance)

to be afraid (of); to show fear
